subNodes.conversationText: root
A man in traveler’s robes and a long, worn face greeted the young witch with surprise. He was a witch -- a witch can always identify another witch.
[Continue.]
“This corner of the country is busier than I remember. A royal escort -- a magician -- the Congress of Moths leaping out of every shadow... And now I cross paths with another wandering witch!"
"Indeed. What are you doing here?"
"Don't worry, I don't mean to step on your toes. I'm only passing through."
[Continue.]

"You must be with Eldest Lady’s coven -- or, no, I don’t sense the power of a coven behind you. An independent, then, like me? What's your name? I’m Jarum of the Grasses, and I'm on my way to Res Ardor. The warlord wants a witch, so a witch I bring him.”
"Pleased to meet you. I'm . You must owe Res Ardor a favor. Aren't they supposed to come to us?"
"A vision called me there."
"A vision brought me here, too. Eldest Lady needed a third."
“So I was half-right -- you do have some connection to Eldest Lady. Why hasn't she bound you to the coven yet?"
“She will, but only once I bring her the blood of whoever killed the last witch bound to the coven."
“Well, Eldest Lady has a reputation for being strange."
"They're testing me first."
"That's puzzling. A vision brought you. There's no better proof than that."
[Continue.]
“Well, Eldest Lady has a reputation for being strange."
"She is. And her witchcraft is like nothing I've witnessed."

"I envy you. She's certainly one of the most powerful witches alive."

Knott had taken the shape of a normal gourd again, or Jarum might have seen living proof of his assertion.
[Continue.]
“Well, may you walk easy, and may the Moths gather away from your path. I must be off -- Res Ardor is far, and I mean to enjoy several nights at the Bonnyjoy on my way there."
"The Bonnyjoy?"
"One of the best kept secrets of Dudow. A tiny inn right on the border of the woods. You should make a point of visiting."
"I see. Farewell, Jarum."
"Farewell. Safe travels."
"A witch who isn't strange is no witch at all."

"True, true," he laughed. “Well, may you walk easy, and may the Moths gather away from your path. I must be off -- Res Ardor is far, and I mean to enjoy a night or three at the Bonnyjoy on my way there."
"The Bonnyjoy?"
"Farewell. Safe travels."
"I see."
"And you?"
"You weren't wrong before. Eldest Lady brought me here. I'm not a part of her coven yet, but I will be."
"She hasn't bound you yet?"
“She will, but only once I bring her the blood of whoever killed the last witch bound to the coven."
"They're testing me first."
"A vision brought me here, too. Eldest Lady needed a third."
The young witch introduced <him/her>self. "It's a long road to Res Ardor."
"A vision called me there."
"Royal escort?"

"Yes, the king makes for Wan with a small entourage. There are more convenient roads, but for some reason they decided to travel this way. I haven't seen them myself, but all the towns I passed through on the way here were humming with the news."

He studied <FirstName>.
[Continue.]

"You must be with Eldest Lady’s coven -- or, no, I don’t sense the power of a coven behind you. An independent, then, like me? What's your name? I’m Jarum of the Grasses, and I'm on my way to Res Ardor. The warlord wants a witch, so a witch I bring him.”
"There's a magician here?"

"So I've heard. People from Jad Bizunta never come to Dudow unless it's mock the backwards ways of Dudovians, but she's here on some sort of private business, I gather -- looking for someone, I think. I don't know the particulars and didn't her see myself, but all the towns I passed through on the way here were humming with the news."
[Continue.]
